falconz package

Submodules

falconz.constants module

This module contains the constants that are used in the falconz.

The variables in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz.

falconz.display module

This module shows predefined display messages for the falconz.

Usage:

The functions in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz to show predefined display messages.

falconz.display.expectations()[source][source]

Display expected modalities for FALCON. This is used to check if the user has provided the correct set of modalities for each tracer set.

Returns

None

Display FALCON logo.

Returns

falconz.download module

Note

Research Group: Quantitative Imaging and Medical Physics (QIMP) Team

Version: 0.1.0

Date: 04.07.2023

Usage

The functions in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz to download the necessary binaries and models for the falconz.

falconz.download.download(item_name, item_path, item_dict)[source][source]

Downloads the item (model or binary) for the current system.

Parameters

  • item_name (str) – The name of the item to download.

  • item_path (str) – The path to store the item.

  • item_dict (dict) – The dictionary containing item info.

Returns

The path to the downloaded item.

Return type

str

falconz.falconz module

falconz.falconz.main()[source][source]

Main function to execute the FalconZ motion correction pipeline.

It involves the following steps:

  1. Initialization (e.g. argument parsing)

  2. Input validation and preparation

  3. Downloading necessary binaries

  4. Standardizing input data

  5. Performing motion correction

  6. Cleaning up and finalizing results

Parameters

None – This function doesn’t take any direct arguments, but processes command line arguments.

Returns

None. But as a side-effect, produces motion-corrected images and other outputs.

falconz.file_utilities module

This module provides various utilities to handle file operations necessary for the falconz project.

Usage:

The functions in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz to perform file operations.

  • destination (str) – The path to the destination directory.

Parameters

  • destination (str) – The path to the destination directory.

falconz.image_processing module

This module handles image processing for the falconz.

Usage:

The functions in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz to perform image conversion.

class falconz.image_processing.ImageRegistration(fixed_img: str, multi_resolution_iterations: str, fixed_mask: Optional[str] = None)[source][source]

Bases: object

A class for performing image registration using the Greedy method.

fixed_imgstr

Path to the fixed/target image for registration.

multi_resolution_iterationsstr

String specifying the number of iterations at each resolution level.

fixed_maskstr, optional

Path to a mask for the fixed image. If provided, only the masked region of the fixed image will be used in the registration.

moving_imgstr, optional

Path to the moving/source image to be registered to the fixed image.

transform_filesdict, optional

Dictionary containing paths to the output transformation files for each registration type.

affine() → str[source][source]

Perform affine registration between the moving and fixed images.

str

Path to the resulting affine transformation file.

deformable() → tuple[source][source]

Perform deformable registration between the moving and fixed images.

tuple

A tuple containing paths to the resulting affine, warp, and inverse warp transformation files.

registration(registration_type: str) → None[source][source]

Register the moving image to the fixed image using the specified registration type.

registration_typestr

Type of registration to perform. Supported values are ‘rigid’, ‘affine’, and ‘deformable’.

resample(resampled_moving_img: str, registration_type: str, segmentation='', resampled_seg='') → None[source][source]

Resample the moving image based on the computed transformation.

resampled_moving_imgstr

Path to save the resampled moving image.

registration_typestr

Type of registration used. Supported values are ‘rigid’, ‘affine’, and ‘deformable’.

segmentationstr, optional

Path to the segmentation of the moving image.

resampled_segstr, optional

Path to save the resampled segmentation.

rigid() → str[source][source]

Perform rigid registration between the moving and fixed images.

str

Path to the resulting rigid transformation file.

set_moving_image(moving_img: str, update_transforms: bool = True)[source][source]

Sets the moving image for registration and updates the transform files if specified.

Parameters

  • moving_img (str) – Path to the moving/source image.

  • update_transforms (bool) – If True, will update the paths for the transformation files based on the moving image name. Default is True.

falconz.image_processing.align(fixed_img=<class 'str'>, moving_imgs=<class 'list'>, registration_type=<class 'str'>, multi_resolution_iterations=<class 'str'>, moco_dir=<class 'str'>)[source][source]

Aligns the moving images to the fixed image using the specified registration type.

Parameters

  • fixed_img (str) – The path to the fixed image.

  • moving_imgs (list) – A list of paths to the moving images.

  • registration_type (str) – The type of registration to use.

  • multi_resolution_iterations (str) – The number of iterations to use for multi-resolution registration.

  • moco_dir (str) – The directory to store the resampled moving images.

falconz.image_processing.calc_mean_intensity(image: str) → float[source][source]

Calculates the mean intensity of an image using SimpleITK :param image: path to the image :return: mean intensity of the image :rtype: float

falconz.image_processing.calc_voxelwise_ncc_images(image1: str, image2: str, output_dir: str) → str[source][source]

Calculates voxelwise normalized cross correlation between two images and writes it to the output directory.

Parameters

  • image1 (str) – The path to the first image.

  • image2 (str) – The path to the second image.

  • output_dir (str) – The path to the output directory.

Returns

The path to the voxelwise ncc image.

Return type

str

falconz.image_processing.determine_candidate_frames(candidate_files: list, reference_file: str, output_dir: str, njobs: int) → int[source][source]

Determines the candidate frames of a 4D PET series on which motion correction can be performed effectively :param candidate_files: list of 3D candidate moving PET files :param reference_file: path to the reference PET file :param output_dir: path to the parent directory of the candidate files :param njobs: number of jobs to run in parallel :return: Index of the starting frame from which motion correction can be performed :rtype: int

Downscale an image based on the shrink factor and save it to the output directory.

Parameters

  • input_image (str) – The path to the input image.

Returns

The path to the downscaled image.

str

falconz.resources module

This module contains the urls and filenames of the binaries that are required for the falconz.

Usage:

The variables in this module can be imported and used in other modules within the falconz to download the necessary binaries for the falconz.
